rows.text_1_facilitator:
Today's topic is about managing stress.

We know how stressful it is to bring up teenagers in these times. Learning to manage your stress helps you ‚Äì and your family.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Today's topic is about managing stress.

We know how stressful it is to bring up teenagers in these times. Learning to manage your stress helps you ‚Äì and your family.

media_title.eng: Can managing stress help you and your family? Tap play to find out

media_transcript.eng:
Greetings everyone.

Today's topic is managing stress.

It is important to know how to manage our stress. At times our children can behave in ways that make us feel stressed and us as parents can make our children feel stressed too.

So, it is important to notice when we feel stressed and take a pause and breathe. That will help you manage your stress.

rows.media_title: Can managing stress help you and your family? Tap play to find out
rows.media_transcript:
Greetings everyone.

Today's topic is managing stress.

It is important to know how to manage our stress. At times our children can behave in ways that make us feel stressed and us as parents can make our children feel stressed too.

So, it is important to notice when we feel stressed and take a pause and breathe. That will help you manage your stress.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
With a few small changes, you can feel more peaceful in your normal day-to-day life.

When you are peaceful, your family members will get calmer too!

text_1_facilitator.eng:
With a few small changes, you can feel more peaceful in your normal day-to-day life.

When you are peaceful, your family members will get calmer too!

media_title.eng: Pause, take a breath. Now hear how taking a simple pause helped @data.characters.media_female_4.name and her teens

media_transcript.eng:
Life is tough sometimes. Before I joined @global.app_name, I used to be grumpy at all times. I would take out my anger on everyone at home, not only my teens but even my husband as well. They would run away when I came home because they knew I would start yelling at them.

Learning to take a pause and breathe was difficult at first. But every time I tried it, it helped me to calm down. Now my teens are no longer running away when I come home and they actually listen better than when I used to shout at them!

rows.media_title: Pause, take a breath. Now hear how taking a simple pause helped @data.characters.media_female_4.name and her teens
rows.media_transcript:
Life is tough sometimes. Before I joined @global.app_name, I used to be grumpy at all times. I would take out my anger on everyone at home, not only my teens but even my husband as well. They would run away when I came home because they knew I would start yelling at them.

Learning to take a pause and breathe was difficult at first. But every time I tried it, it helped me to calm down. Now my teens are no longer running away when I come home and they actually listen better than when I used to shout at them!

rows.text_1_facilitator: Let‚Äôs look at an example of how stress can sometimes just get too much, for all of us:

text_1_facilitator.eng: Let‚Äôs look at an example of how stress can sometimes just get too much, for all of us:

text_2.eng: @data.characters.f1_father.name lost his job. He was sitting at home feeling frustrated and stressed when @data.characters.f1_son_18.name entered the room.

rows.text_2: @data.characters.f1_father.name lost his job. He was sitting at home feeling frustrated and stressed when @data.characters.f1_son_18.name entered the room.

rows.character_1_text: Can I have money to buy some airtime?

character_2_text.eng: Leave me alone and mind your own business!

text_2.eng: @data.characters.f1_father.name lost his job. He was sitting at home feeling frustrated and stressed, when his son @data.characters.f1_son_18.name entered the room.

character_1_text.eng: Can I have money to buy some airtime?

character_2_text.eng: *(taking a breath)* I‚Äôm sorry son. I had a difficult day today. The boss fired me.

rows.text_2: @data.characters.f1_father.name lost his job. He was sitting at home feeling frustrated and stressed, when his son @data.characters.f1_son_18.name entered the room.
rows.character_1_text: Can I have money to buy some airtime?
rows.character_2_text: *(taking a breath)* I‚Äôm sorry son. I had a difficult day today. The boss fired me.

rows.character_1_text: Oh no! I need a new school uniform.

character_1_text.eng: Oh no! I need a new school uniform.

character_2_text.eng: I‚Äôll try, son, and your @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name's job will help us get by while I look for another job.

rows.character_2_text: I‚Äôll try, son, and your @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name's job will help us get by while I look for another job.

rows.character_1_text: Should I also help you look for work, @data.characters.f1_father.role_name?

character_1_text.eng: Should I also help you look for work, @data.characters.f1_father.role_name?

character_2_text.eng: No it‚Äôs okay, @data.characters.f1_son_18.name. I appreciate your offer. The most important thing is that you work hard at school. Thanks for listening to me.

rows.character_2_text: No it‚Äôs okay, @data.characters.f1_son_18.name. I appreciate your offer. The most important thing is that you work hard at school. Thanks for listening to me.

rows.character_1_text: Let‚Äôs play some soccer together. It will help me get this stress off my mind for a bit.

character_1_text.eng: Let‚Äôs play some soccer together. It will help me get this stress off my mind for a bit.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Now let's look at an example where something simple, like a Safety Word, can help manage stress and keep your teen safe. 

First, think back to when you were a teenager. Was there ever a time when you were in danger but you could not tell your family because they would have been angry?

This ALMOST happened to @data.characters.f1_son_18.name and @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name! Let‚Äôs have a look:

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Now let's look at an example where something simple, like a Safety Word, can help manage stress and keep your teen safe. 

First, think back to when you were a teenager. Was there ever a time when you were in danger but you could not tell your family because they would have been angry?

This ALMOST happened to @data.characters.f1_son_18.name and @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name! Let‚Äôs have a look:

character_1_text.eng: Don‚Äôt tell the adults, but I am going to a bar with my friends tonight.

character_2_text.eng: Have fun! I told them I am staying with my girlfriend, but I am actually going to a cool party.

rows.character_1_text: Don‚Äôt tell the adults, but I am going to a bar with my friends tonight.
rows.character_2_text: Have fun! I told them I am staying with my girlfriend, but I am actually going to a cool party.

rows.character_1_text: I think they are dealing drugs. We could all get arrested. But I can‚Äôt tell my parents ‚Äì they will be so angry!

character_1_text.eng: I think they are dealing drugs. We could all get arrested. But I can‚Äôt tell my parents ‚Äì they will be so angry!

rows.character_1_text: I am scared. Everyone is too drunk to drive me home. This guy says he will take me, but he wants us to go to his house first. I can‚Äôt tell my parents ‚Äì I lied about coming to this party.

character_1_text.eng: I am scared. Everyone is too drunk to drive me home. This guy says he will take me, but he wants us to go to his house first. I can‚Äôt tell my parents ‚Äì I lied about coming to this party.

rows.text_1_facilitator: These are dangerous situations! Thankfully, @data.characters.f1_son_18.name and @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name then remembered what their father told them:

text_1_facilitator.eng: These are dangerous situations! Thankfully, @data.characters.f1_son_18.name and @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name then remembered what their father told them:

character_1_text.eng:
I care about your safety more than anything. If you are ever upset, or scared, you can always call me for help, or tell me about it.

Shall we use an imaginary ‚ÄòAunty Cecilia‚Äô as our Safety Word? Just say something about Aunty Cecilia, I promise that I will try my best to help and I will not be angry ‚Äì even if you are doing something you shouldn't be doing.

rows.character_1_text:
I care about your safety more than anything. If you are ever upset, or scared, you can always call me for help, or tell me about it.

Shall we use an imaginary ‚ÄòAunty Cecilia‚Äô as our Safety Word? Just say something about Aunty Cecilia, I promise that I will try my best to help and I will not be angry ‚Äì even if you are doing something you shouldn't be doing.
Hey father, how is Aunty Cecilia doing now?

character_1_text.eng: Hey father, how is Aunty Cecilia doing now?

character_2_text.eng: *(on the other side of the phone)* Not well. We need you at home. I will come pick you up right away. Where are you?

rows.character_2_text: *(on the other side of the phone)* Not well. We need you at home. I will come pick you up right away. Where are you?

rows.character_1_text: (ü§î_thinking_) I think my friends are in trouble. I don‚Äôt want to stop being their friend, but I‚Äôm worried. Maybe @data.characters.f1_father.role_name knows what to do.

character_1_text.eng: (ü§î_thinking_) I think my friends are in trouble. I don‚Äôt want to stop being their friend, but I‚Äôm worried. Maybe @data.characters.f1_father.role_name knows what to do.

character_2_text.eng: @data.characters.f1_father.role_name, I just remembered, Aunty Cecilia said she will come visit tomorrow.

character_3_text.eng: *(on the other side of the phone)* Okay, I need you at home to help get things ready. I will come pick you up now. Where are you?

rows.character_2_text: @data.characters.f1_father.role_name, I just remembered, Aunty Cecilia said she will come visit tomorrow.
rows.character_3_text: *(on the other side of the phone)* Okay, I need you at home to help get things ready. I will come pick you up now. Where are you?

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Having a Safety Word can help your teen stay safe too. You can choose any word as a Safety Word. Only your family knows it means ‚Äòhelp‚Äô.

Your teen can say this word to let you know they are in trouble without you getting angry or punishing them, so you can help them.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Having a Safety Word can help your teen stay safe too. You can choose any word as a Safety Word. Only your family knows it means ‚Äòhelp‚Äô.

Your teen can say this word to let you know they are in trouble without you getting angry or punishing them, so you can help them.

text_2.eng:
**What Safety Word can you choose with your teen? Here are some ideas from other families:**

ü•ë A specific food
üëµüèΩ A specific family member
üêí A specific animal
ü§î Something else

ü•ë A specific food
üëµüèΩ A specific family member
üêí A specific animal
ü§î Something else

rows.text_1_facilitator: Here are a few skills to help you manage stress that you can use with your teens!

text_1_facilitator.eng: Here are a few skills to help you manage stress that you can use with your teens!

section_1_text.eng:
Breathe slowly. Pause.

Before you say anything, slowly breathe in and out five times. It will calm you, and give you a chance to think.

section_2_text.eng:
Share how you feel.

This is hard. Many of us were told not to cry, or show our feelings to our children. But take a deep breath and calmly tell them how you feel. They will understand better, and also learn from you how to deal with stress.

section_3_text.eng:
Show them you care.

This is also hard! Stress makes us focus on ourselves. But our teens need our support. Ask them how they feel. Listen to them and comfort them. Try a hug or say "I understand". It can change everything.

section_4_text.eng:
Seek the positive.

Can you and your teen think about ideas that might help? Can you do something positive together to take your mind off the stress?

rows.section_1_text:
Breathe slowly. Pause.

Before you say anything, slowly breathe in and out five times. It will calm you, and give you a chance to think.
rows.section_2_text:
Share how you feel.

This is hard. Many of us were told not to cry, or show our feelings to our children. But take a deep breath and calmly tell them how you feel. They will understand better, and also learn from you how to deal with stress.
rows.section_3_text:
Show them you care.

This is also hard! Stress makes us focus on ourselves. But our teens need our support. Ask them how they feel. Listen to them and comfort them. Try a hug or say "I understand". It can change everything.
rows.section_4_text:
Seek the positive.

Can you and your teen think about ideas that might help? Can you do something positive together to take your mind off the stress?

rows.text_1_facilitator:
There are two home activities for this week:

1) Whenever you are feeling stressed or upset with your teen, take five breaths in and out before you react.
And when you're both calm, share with each other how you feel. 

2) Choose a "Safety Word" with your teen, and think of a situation together when you could use this.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
There are two home activities for this week:

1) Whenever you are feeling stressed or upset with your teen, take five breaths in and out before you react.
And when you're both calm, share with each other how you feel. 

2) Choose a "Safety Word" with your teen, and think of a situation together when you could use this.

text_2.eng:
**Remember to:** 

üòÆ‚Äçüí® BREATHE: take five breaths in and out before you react
ü§ùüèæ SHARE: when you're both calm, share with your teen how you feel
üíô SHOW: ask them how they feel to show you care
üîç SEEK: find something positive in this situation together

quiz_1_question.eng: Can you respond calmly and choose a ‚ÄúSafety Word‚Äù with your teen this week?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Great! Staying calm and having a ‚ÄúSafety Word‚Äù will help you and your family.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: That‚Äôs a good start. When you are stressed, remember to take a few deep breaths, it will make it easier to respond calmly.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: I understand, sometimes we just don‚Äôt have capacity. Try to keep spending time with your teen - whenever you are ready you can practise responding calmly and find a Safety Word together.

rows.quiz_1_feedback_1: Great! Staying calm and having a ‚ÄúSafety Word‚Äù will help you and your family.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Remember, when we practice responding calmly and sharing how we feel, our teens learn to do the same. This skill will help them their whole life!

text_1_facilitator.eng: Remember, when we practice responding calmly and sharing how we feel, our teens learn to do the same. This skill will help them their whole life!

media_title.eng: Hear how @data.characters.media_son_1.name learned to stay calm from his father

media_transcript.eng:
Whenever I would do something wrong, my father would get so angry at me and beat me. He would not even listen to me and I would get so angry as well at him and everyone else.

Now, when he gets angry, he first takes a few deep breaths before he responds. It makes everyone calm down instead of causing a big fight.

It really helped me at home and at school, because even me I am no longer slashing everyone and I am no longer this moody person. When I feel really angry or stressed, I also take deep breaths like my father does. I am a different person.

rows.media_title: Hear how @data.characters.media_son_1.name learned to stay calm from his father
rows.media_transcript:
Whenever I would do something wrong, my father would get so angry at me and beat me. He would not even listen to me and I would get so angry as well at him and everyone else.

Now, when he gets angry, he first takes a few deep breaths before he responds. It makes everyone calm down instead of causing a big fight.

It really helped me at home and at school, because even me I am no longer slashing everyone and I am no longer this moody person. When I feel really angry or stressed, I also take deep breaths like my father does. I am a different person.
